To the chief Musician, A Psalm of David. I waited patiently for the LORD; and he inclined unto me, and heard my cry.<RF>I waited…: Heb. In waiting I waited<Rf>
He brought me up also out of an horrible pit, out of the miry clay, and set my feet upon a rock, <FI>and<Fi> established my goings.<RF>an…: Heb. a pit of noise<Rf>
And he hath put a new song in my mouth, <FI>even<Fi> praise unto our God: many shall see <FI>it<Fi>, and fear, and shall trust in the LORD.
Blessed <FI>is<Fi> that man that maketh the LORD his trust, and respecteth not the proud, nor such as turn aside to lies.

Many, O LORD my God, <FI>are<Fi> thy wonderful works <FI>which<Fi> thou hast done, and thy thoughts <FI>which are<Fi> to us-ward: they cannot be reckoned up in order unto thee: <FI>if<Fi> I would declare and speak <FI>of them<Fi>, they are more than can be numbered.<RF>they cannot…: or, none can order them unto thee<Rf><CM>
Sacrifice and offering thou didst not desire; mine ears hast thou opened: burnt offering and sin offering hast thou not required.<RF>opened: Heb. digged<Rf>
Then said I, Lo, I come: in the volume of the book <FI>it is<Fi> written of me,
I delight to do thy will, O my God: yea, thy law <FI>is<Fi> within my heart.<RF>within…: Heb. in the midst of my bowels<Rf>
I have preached righteousness in the great congregation: lo, I have not refrained my lips, O LORD, thou knowest.
I have not hid thy righteousness within my heart; I have declared thy faithfulness and thy salvation: I have not concealed thy lovingkindness and thy truth from the great congregation.<CM>
Withhold not thou thy tender mercies from me, O LORD: let thy lovingkindness and thy truth continually preserve me.

For innumerable evils have compassed me about: mine iniquities have taken hold upon me, so that I am not able to look up; they are more than the hairs of mine head: therefore my heart faileth me.<RF>falleth: Heb. forsaketh<Rf>
Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me: O LORD, make haste to help me.
Let them be ashamed and confounded together that seek after my soul to destroy it; let them be driven backward and put to shame that wish me evil.
Let them be desolate for a reward of their shame that say unto me, Aha, aha.
Let all those that seek thee rejoice and be glad in thee: let such as love thy salvation say continually, The LORD be magnified.
But I <FI>am<Fi> poor and needy; <FI>yet<Fi> the Lord thinketh upon me: thou <FI>art<Fi> my help and my deliverer; make no tarrying, O my God.<CM>
